content:
Prevent Spam Cases with reCAPTCHA

We recommend adding reCAPTCHA v2 to your Web-to-Case web form to prevent spambots from wasting service agents’ time and muddying your case data. The reCAPTCHA widget requires customers to select an “I’m not a robot” checkbox before they can create a case.

Available in: Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience, Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions

How do I add reCAPTCHA to my Web-to-Case form?

Sign up for reCAPTCHA on the Google website. Turn on reCAPTCHA in your Web-to-Case settings. Generate and test the Web-to-Case HTML code, making sure that the fields related to reCAPTCHA are completed.

Can I add reCAPTCHA to a Web-to-Case web form that’s already live?

Yes. You must regenerate the HTML code to include the reCAPTCHA verification code and update the code on your website.

How else can I avoid spam cases?

reCAPTCHA is your first line of defense against spammers using your Web-to-Case web form. You can also use a spam filter app, create a dynamic web form that uses PHP programming language and JavaScript, or use a workflow rule to detect cases from specific sources.

How does Salesforce validate reCAPTCHA?

Salesforce uses Google’s API to validate the reCAPTCHA API key pair you enter in Setup. We make sure that the key pair is valid and that it hasn’t expired. If we can’t validate the key pair, incoming requests fail.

How does Web-to-Case isolate harmful data?

All data from Web-to-Case requests is saved to Salesforce cases using safeHTML. If a request fails reCAPTCHA verification, no case is created.
title: Prevent Spam Cases with reCAPTCHA
